revised_title: Anniversary Meeting November 30, 1896: Celebrating the Lives and Contributions of Fellows
tldr: The Royal Society held its Anniversary Meeting on November 30, 1896, to honor the lives and contributions of its Fellows who passed away since the last meeting. The meeting celebrated the achievements of Sir William Grove, Sir Joseph Prestwich, Armand Hippolyte Louis Fizeau, and Hubert Anson Newton, among others, who made significant contributions to various scientific disciplines, including physics, chemistry, astronomy, biology, medicine, mathematics, engineering, and the humanities.
scientific_discipline: Social Sciences, Art, and Humanities > Biographies and Book Reviews
